elements.content: Solvatomagnetic effect and spin-glass behavior in a 1D coordination polymer constructed from EE-azido bridged MnIII3O units†polymer Cai-Ming Liu De-Qing Zhang and Dao-Ben Zhu IIIazidopolymer1polymers1azidopolymer23azido4azidopolymermethanolsolvent5ligandrecrystallizationTGAoxidation6ligand7a7b7bazidonitrogen atommethanolmethanolligandsazidonitrogen atomThe 1D chain structure of 1.The 1D chain structure of 2.solventIIIPlots of χTvs. T of 1 and 2 measured under 1 kOe. The solid lines represent the best theoretical fitting.7a89Plots of FC and ZFC susceptibilities vs. temperature of 1 at an applied field of 20 Oe. Ac susceptibilities of 1 measured in an ac field of 1 Oe.solventpolymers7polymerpolymerII1,10-phenanthrolineEtOHethanol10azidopolymerpolymers29812312524645193–19535363912643125286321284510† Electronic supplementary information (ESI) available: The Vogel–Fulcher fit, M–H curve and hysteresis loops for 1. See DOI: 10.1039/b715080f‡ Synthesis: Brppz (0.5 mmol), Mn(acac)2 (0.5 mmol), Gd(NO3)2·6H2O (0.1 mmol) in 25 mL of methanol–water (10 : 1 v/v) mixed solvents were stirred at room temperature for 10 min, then 0.5 mmol of NaN3 was added, after stirring for 1 h, a dark green solution was formed, which was allowed to slowly evaporate for about two weeks, giving dark-green block crystals of 1. Yield: ∼30% based on Mn. 2 was obtained by exposing 1 to air at room temperature for two weeks. Elemental analysis (%): calc. for C30H27Br3Mn3N9O7 (2): C 34.98, H 2.64, N 12.24; found: C 35.02, H 2.69, N 12.10. IR (KBr): ν = 3423s, 2076m, 1954w, 1550m, 1482s, 1447m, 1398w, 1334w, 1289s, 1247w, 1145m, 1081m, 1018w, 952w, 864w, 812w, 775w, 719m, 664w, 619m, 458w cm–1. CAUTION: NaN3 is potentially explosive and should be handled with care!

† Electronic supplementary information (ESI) available: The Vogel-Fulcher fit, M-H curve and hysteresis loops for 1. See DOI: 10.1039/b715080f

‡ Synthesis: Brppz (0.5 mmol), Mn(acac)2 (0.5 mmol), Gd(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.1 mmol) in 25 mL of methanol-water (10 : 1 v/v) mixed solvents were stirred at room temperature for 10 min, then 0.5 mmol of NaN3 was added, after stirring for 1 h, a dark green solution was formed, which was allowed to slowly evaporate for about two weeks, giving dark-green block crystals of 1. Yield: ~30% based on Mn. 2 was obtained by exposing 1 to air at room temperature for two weeks. Elemental analysis (%): calc. for C30H27Br3Mn3N9O7 (2): C 34.98, H 2.64, N 12.24; found: C 35.02, H 2.69, N 12.10. IR (KBr): ν = 3423s, 2076m, 1954w, 1550m, 1482s, 1447m, 1398w, 1334w, 1289s, 1247w, 1145m, 1081m, 1018w, 952w, 864w, 812w, 775w, 719m, 664w, 619m, 458w cm-1. CAUTION: NaN3 is potentially explosive and should be handled with care!

elements.content: methanolwatersolventsElemental analysisIRCAUTION:explosive§ Crystal data for [MnIII3O(Brppz)3(MeOH)3(N3)]·2MeOH (1): monoclinic, P21/c, a = 19.1576(12), b = 8.2244(5), c = 25.5724(17) Å, β = 98.152(3)°, V = 3988.5(4) Å3, Z = 4, T = 113(2) K, Dc = 1.821 g cm–3, µ = 4.003 mm–1, GOF = 1.123, R1 = 0.0651, wR2 = 0.1406 (I > 2σ(I)). Crystal data for [MnIII3O(Brppz)3(MeOH)3(N3)] (2): monoclinic, P21/c, a = 18.476(4), b = 8.138(2), c = 25.446(5) Å, β = 93.25(3)°, V = 3819.8(15) Å3, Z = 4, T = 293(2) K, Dc = 1.791 g cm–3, µ = 4.170 mm–1, GOF = 0.955, R1 = 0.0711, wR2 = 0.1456 (I > σ(I)). Two methyl groups in two coordinated methanol molecules of 2 are disordered, with occupancies of 0.67 and 0.33 for (C28, C29) and (C28′, C29′), respectively. CCDC 662330–662331. For crystallographic data in CIF or other electronic format see DOI: 10.1039/b715080f

Crystal data for [MnIII3O(Brppz)3(MeOH)3(N3)] (2): monoclinic, P21/c, a = 18.476(4), b = 8.138(2), c = 25.446(5) Å, β = 93.25(3)°, V = 3819.8(15) Å3, Z = 4, T = 293(2) K, Dc = 1.791 g cm-3, µ = 4.170 mm-1, GOF = 0.955, R1 = 0.0711, wR2 = 0.1456 (I > σ(I)). Two methyl groups in two coordinated methanol molecules of 2 are disordered, with occupancies of 0.67 and 0.33 for (C28, C29) and (C28', C29'), respectively. CCDC 662330-662331. For crystallographic data in CIF or other electronic format see DOI: 10.1039/b715080f

elements.content: crystallographic data¶ The magnetic susceptibility measurements were carried out on numerous fine single crystals (18.88 mg of freshly prepared 1; after being exposed to air at room temperature for two weeks, it transformed to sample 2, calc. 17.77 mg) on a Quantum Design MPMS-XL5 SQUID magnetometer. Diamagnetic corrections were estimated from Pascal's constants for all constituent atoms.
elements.clean_text:
crystallographic data

¶ The magnetic susceptibility measurements were carried out on numerous fine single crystals (18.88 mg of freshly prepared 1; after being exposed to air at room temperature for two weeks, it transformed to sample 2, calc. 17.77 mg) on a Quantum Design MPMS-XL5 SQUID magnetometer. Diamagnetic corrections were estimated from Pascal's constants for all constituent atoms.

elements.content: SQUID magnetometer
